lines.text: [as the Giant flies toward the missle]

[in the Giant's mind]
You are who you choose to be.
Superman.

[to the Giant, in battle mode]
It's bad to kill. Guns kill. And you don't have to be a gun. You are what you choose to be. You choose. Choose.
I know you feel bad about the deer, but it's not your fault. Things die. That's part of life. It's bad to kill, but it's not bad to die.
You die?
Well, yes, someday.
I die?
I don't know. You're made of metal, but you have feelings, and you think about things, and that means you have a soul. And souls don't die.
Soul?
Mom says it's something inside of all good things, and that it goes on forever and ever.
[Hogarth leaves. The Iron Giant lays back to look at the stars]
Souls don't die.

[as a nuclear missile is headed for Rockwell]
I fix.
Giant?
Hogarth. I go. You stay.
[lifts Hogarth's chin with a finger and waves his other finger at him]
No following.
I love you.
[the Giant takes off to intercept the rocket]
I am not a gun.
Would you say grace, please?
[Hogarth sees the Giant's hand in the kitchen]

Oh my God... Um, uh... oh, my God! We... thank you for the... er, food that mom has put in front of us and *stop!*... uh, the Devil... from doing bad things? And er, get out of here!... Uh, Satan? Go! Go so... that we may live in peace. Amen.
Amen. That was... hmm, really unusual, Hogarth.
us.
Look, it's none of my business, but who cares what these creeps think of you? They don't make you what you are, you do. You are who you choose to be.

[talking very fast, on caffeine]
So she moved me up a grade 'cause I wasn't fitting in, so now I'm even more not fitting in. I was getting good grades, you know, like all A's. So my mom says, "You need stimulation," and I go, "No, I'm stimulated enough right now."
That's for sure.

So she says, "Uh-uh, You don't have a challenge, you need a challenge." So now I'm challenged, all right- I'm challenged to hold on to my lunch money because of all the big mooses who wanna pound me, 'cause they think I'm a shrimpy dork who thinks he's smarter than them! But I don't think I'm smarter, I just do the stupid homework! If everyone else JUST DID THE STUPID HOMEWORK, they could move up a grade and get pounded, too! Is there anymore coffee?
Get back! I said get back! I mean it!
No. Stop. Wait.
It was an accident. He's our friend.
He's a piece of hardware, Hogarth. Why did you think the army was here? He's a weapon, a big... big gun that walks.
I... I not gun.
Yeah? Then what's that?
[Points at huge hole the Giant's ray left on a bus]
You almost did that to Hogarth!
No!
[Runs away]
Wait!
[Runs after the Giant]
Hogarth!
Come back!

[sees the toy gun Hogarth left on the ground]
It was being defensive. He reacted to the gun.
That missile is targeted to the giant's current position! WHERE'S THE GIANT, MANSLEY?
Oooh... We can duck and cover! There's a fallout shelter not far from...
There's no way to survive this thing, you idiot!
You mean we're all going to...
To die, Mansley. For our country.
Screw our country! I WANT TO LIVE!
Hey, Dean! Watch this!
All right, we're watching.
This one's for professionals only! Banzai!
[dives into lake, starts shivering]
Come on in! The water's... great.
No, thanks.
You... weenie!
[to the Giant]
Come on in. It's really, really refreshing.
[the Giant walks away]
What? You too? You... big baby!

[the sound of the Giant running is heard; suddenly he jumps into the water]
Banzai!
No Atomo... I Superman!
Your mom's working late tonight, Hogarth, so it's just us guys, and we're gonna have a little chat. Sit down!
[shoves Hogarth onto a chair and shines a bright light on him]
How's that? A little too bright? Good. Forgive me, Hogarth. I wanted you to learn something.
What can I learn from you?
You can learn this, Hogarth. That I can do anything I want, whenever I want if I feel it's in the people's best interest. The giant metal man. Where is it?
I don't know what you're talking about.
You don't? Does this ring a bell?
[lays down the picture Hogarth took of the aluminum siding he used to lure the Giant]
No? How about this?
[lays down the photo Hogarth accidentally took of himself - with the Giant behind him]
You've been careless, Hogarth.
It doesn't prove anything.
It's enough to get the army here with one phone call.
Then what's stopping you?

[angry]
Where's the giant?
[Grabs Hogarth by the jaw]
You can't protect him, Hogarth, anymore than you can... protect your mother.
My mom?

It's difficult to raise a boy all alone. We can make it more difficult. In fact, we can make it so difficult that it would be irresponsible for us to leave you in her care, and all that that implies. You'll be taken away from her, Hogarth.
You can't do that!
Oh, we can, and we will.
He's at the junkyard. McCoppin's Scrap off Culver Road.
The junkyard, of course! Food for the metal eater. I wouldn't worry about this, Hogarth. This isn't really happening. It's only... a bad dream.
[puts a chloroform rag on Hogarth's mouth, leaving him unconscious]
The army arrives in the morning, Hogarth. Don't get cute.

I'm telling the truth, dang it! It came from outer space. I saw it! And it was headed toward land. I called the government in Washington. Maybe it was a sputnik, or... or an invader from Mars. That's what it is, an invader from Mars! It was a spaceship of some kind. An unidentified flying object...
Unidentified? Knowing you, Earl, I'd say it was either whiskey or beer.
[others laugh]
Hey! I saw it too.
I rest my case.
[others laugh]
I believe you. What if it is Sputnik, or a flying saucer from Mars? I bet we could find it.
Sorry, kid. I didn't really see anything. But if we don't stick up for the kooks, who will?
the Atomic Age. But there's a dark side to progress, Hogarth. Ever hear of Sputnik?
Yeah, first satellite in space.

Foreign satellite, Hogarth, and all that that implies. Even now it orbits overhead - Boop! Boop! - watching us. We can't see it but it's there, much like that giant thing in the woods. We don't know what it is or what it can do. I don't feel safe, Hogarth. Do you?
What are you talking about?
What am I talking about?
[Loses patience]

What am I talking about? I'm talking about your goldarned security, Hogarth! While you're snoozing in your widdle jammies, back in Washington we're wide awake and worried! Why? Because everyone wants what we have, Hogarth! Everyone! You think this metal man is fun, but who built it? The Russians? The Chinese? Martians? Canadians? I don't care! All I know is we didn't build it, and that's reason enough to assume the worst and blow it to kingdom come! Now, you are going to tell me about this thing, you are going to lead me to it, and we are going to destroy it before it destroys us!
Hey, mom! You won't believe our good luck. Guess what I found?
Hogarth, we've been through this before. No pets.
But he's not a pet, mom. He's a friend.
Hogarth, we've got to rent a room this year if we're gonna make ends meet, and no one wants to live in a place with shredded upholstery.
You'll never know he's there. I'll keep him in a cage...
...until you feel sorry for him and set him free in the house. You remember the raccoon, Hogarth?
[Shudders]
Oooooh! I remember the raccoon.
[a huge wave has pushed Dean into the middle of a nearby road]
Hey!
Yeah?
You're right in the middle of the road!
YEAH?
All right.
[drives off]
I think that's enough fun for one day.

[after his first meeting with the Hughes family]
HoGARTH? What an embarrassing name. Might as well call him Zeppo, or something like that. What kind of sick person would name a kid Hogar...
Hog- Hug-]
Hog Hug. HOG HUG? HOGARTH HUGHES!
[stops the car he was driving]
[the Iron Giant is eating one of Dean's sculptures]
scrap and art. If you gotta eat one of them, eat the scrap. What you currently have - IN YOUR MOUTH! - is ART.

[seeing the shot deer]
It's dead.
Dead?
[the Giant tries to pick up the deer]
Don't do that!
But... why?
It's dead, understand? They shot it, with that gun.
[the Giant looks at the gun; his eyes narrow and turn red]
Hey, are you all right?

[snaps out of it]
Gun.
Yes. Guns kill.
Guns kill.
A peaceful, uneventful day in a town much like your own. Then suddenly, without warning...
[Explosion]

[echoing]
Atomic holocaust!
The biggest thing in this town is probably the homecoming queen.
What department is that again?
Frankly, I'm not at liberty to divulge the particulars of the agency I work for, and all that that implies.
You mean, national security?
Let me put it this way. Every so often things happen that can't be rationalized in a conventional way. People wanna know their government has a response. I am that response.

You came here just in time. This rich cat, some industrialist wanted him for the lobby of his company. Whipped out his checkbook right on the spot. I said, "You get him for the rest of your life, but, what, I have to give him up the minute I give birth? Give me time to cut the umbilical, man."
Hey, I thought you were in trouble. I had this weird guy following me around, it took me hours to shake him, I kill myself getting out here, and you have him doing... arts and crafts.
You have a problem with arts and crafts, little man?
He's a giant robot. It's a little undignified.
It is? Well then, smart guy, what would you have him do?

Sorry about the crowbar, kid. You'd be surprised how many people want to steal scrap. But, man, once I make it into art, I can't give it away. I mean, what am I? A junkman who makes art or an artist who sells junk? You tell me.
Strange. He's so tight-lipped now, and yesterday he wouldn't stop talking. I mean, hundred-foot robots and whatnot.
Hundred-foot robot? He, he. That's nutty.
[they both laugh]
What else did he say?
Nothing can stop this thing. We've hit it with everything we got.
Not everything, General... the Bomb. The Nautilus has first strike capability and is anchored just off shore.
You scare me, Mansley. You want us to bomb ourselves in order to kill it?
The robot seems to go after whatever attacks it. We can lure it away from the town, then destroy it.

[to soldier]
Radio the Nautilus. Tell them to stand by and await my command.
So we can't call Ripley's Believe it or Not, because... they wouldn't believe it.

I thought you might like, you know, a bedtime story. I have some really cool ones. Mad Magazine - very funny. The Spirit - very cool. Boy's Life - eh. Oh, here. This is Superman. He's a lot like you. Crash-landed on Earth, didn't know what he was doing... but he only uses his powers for good, never for evil. Remember that.
[Giant looks at a comic with a robot like himself on the cover]
Oh, that's Atomo, the metal menace. He's not a hero, he's a villain. But you're not like him. You're a good guy, like Superman.
Super... man.
Can you talk? You know, words? Blah, blah, blah, like that? Can you do that, blah, blah, blah?

[very rusty]
Blah, blah, blah.
Well, you get the idea, anyway.
Oh, hey, I know you. Squirrel boy.
Uh, Hogarth.
By night known as Hogarth.
I'm gonna have coffee. What do you want, some milk, or... what? Milk?
Coffee's fine.
[Dean looks at Hogarth skeptically]
Yeah, I drink it. I'm hip.
I dunno. This is espresso, you know? It's like Coffee-zilla.
I said I'm hip.
[Hogarth groans as he struggles to push the giant's hand out the bathroom window]
You know, this sort of thing is why it's important to always chew your food.

[picking up a rock]
See this? This is called a rock. Rock.

[a little rusty]
Rock.
Good.

[picks up a boulder]
Rock?
Yes!

[picks up a tree]
Rock.
No, no. That is a tree. Rock... tree. Get it?
Rock... tree.
That's right!
Found your pet.
Where?
It's up my leg, man. Squirrel's in my pants, Hogarth, and it's climbing its way out of here.
Don't wig out.
Okay, it's heading north now. I'm sorry, kid.
[to the people in the restaurant]
Excuse me! I'd like to apologize to everyone in advance for this.
[zips down his fly to let the squirrel out, which cause a loud commotion]
Check, please.
Go ahead. Tell him what you saw, Frank.
You're not gonna believe this, but it was a giant... metal... man.
You'll be Chief Inspector of Subway Toilets by the time I'm through with you!
Thanks for the scrap, Floyd. I'm sorry I can't pay you more, but it's got... it's got this large "bite" out of it.
That's why I'm selling it. It's got a large bite out of it.
Yeah, right. What could have done this?
I told you what.
Oh, yeah. Strange invaders.
Thanks for believin' me. I really did call the government. They're sending someone over to take care of the whole thing.
Jeez, Earl, you really are crazy. I mean, who in the hell would the government send?
Hey, big metal guy! I got food here for ya! Metal! Crunchy, delicious metal! Come and get it!

Two nights ago, at approximateley 1900 hours, S.A.T com radar detected an unidentified flying object entering Earth's atmosphere, losing contact with it two-and-a-half miles off the coast of Rockwell. Some assumed it was a large meteor, or a downed satelite, but my office in Washington received a call from someone reporting an actual encounter with the object. This is no meteor, gentlemen. This is something much more serious.

[opens the door for Kent]
Kent Mansley, you work for the government.
I... wasn't going to say that. I have something for you, Hogarth.
Your B-B gun. Where did you find it?
Over at the power station.
Hogarth was there the other night.
Really? See anything unusual there, Hogarth?
No... thing unusual, really.
[the toilet upstairs flushes]
Gotta use the bathroom!
[the toilet upstairs flushes]
Gotta use the bathroom!
You can fly? YOU CAN FLY!
United States Government, eh? That must mean something big is happening here.
No, Marv. Big things happen in big places, and the sooner I file my report, the sooner I can get back to them.
Wow, my own giant robot! I am now the luckiest kid in America! This must be the biggest discovery since, I don't know, television or something!
Hey there, scout! Kent Mansley, I work for the government.

[to other waitress in background]
So, he wants us to hold the mustard and the mayo. How about just hold the flavor altogether?
You realize how much hardware I brought out here? You just blew millions of Uncle Sam's dollars out of your butt!
Well, goodbye.
[Hogarth starts walking away, the Giant follows him]
No, no. Me go, you stay. No following. Good.
[Hogarth walks, the Giant still follows him]
I told you! I'll come back tomorrow! Now, stay!
[Hogarth leaves, the Giant follows him]
No, no, no! Bad robot!

[singing a bomb drill ditty]
Time to duck and cover, the bombs are comin' down. The radiation shower will pour throughout your town. Hands over your head; keep low to the ground. Time to duck and cover, the bombs are comin' down. Duck and cover. Duck and cover. Get under the desk with your sister and your brother. Duck and cover. Duck and cover. Hands over your head; keep low to the ground. And all the kids who don't will cease to be around.
Launch the missile now!
You'll never catch up with him on foot, kid.
[over the telephone]
Sir, this thing is a menace. It destroyed a power station, it... it caused a train wreck!
What did, Mansley? Tell me again, and this time, listen to yourself.

[sighs]
A giant... metal monster.
[Rogard laughs uncontrollably over the phone]
Please, Sir, I've got a feeling about this one.

That's nice, Mansley, but let me explain how things are supposed to work. If you had, say, a footprint, I might be able to send over an expert to make a plaster cast of it. Hell, you get me a photograph of this thing, I can send some troops down there! But you tell me you've got a feeling...
All right... you want evidence? I'll get you evidence. And when I do, I'm gonna want a memo distributed!
That's just swell, Mansley.
And I'm gonna want that memo carbon copied and distributed...
[Rogard hangs up]
Don't shoot! There's a kid in his hand! Kent, he only acts defensively. If you don't shoot, he's harmless. You gotta tell the general.
This is your fault, beatnik. If you haven't interfered...
Will you just listen? Tell the general to stop. He's got the kid with him.
I'll take care of it.
[Dean leaves; Kent goes over to General Rogard]
He said the monster has killed a kid. Sir, we must stop it at all costs.

[On walkie-talkie]
Go to Code Red! Repeat, Code Red!

[Hogarth is trying to show his mom a squirrel he found]
All right, all right, where is this guy?
[Hogarth discovers that the squirrel has gotten lost]
I... will go get him.
Hey, where you going? Where you going, champ, chief, slugger? Where you going? Where you going?
I'm going out!
Well, why don't you take Mr. Mansley with you? You can show him the sights.
Awwww, Mom, the sights?
For some reason the army is parked in our front yard, Mr. Mansley.
Please, call me Kent.
